content.description:
There is a route that goes up the turtle's head, potentially starting from a sit at a harder grade than stand starting at some nice crimps.  This seems to be a compression problem, and may be an excellent route if some of the edges clean up a bit.

This author did not establish this climb, but it had clearly been attempted recently. Mt. Proj requires a grade entry, so a guess of v4 was used. Please let me know if you have further information (name, FA, grade, rating, etc.) and I will happily adjust this entry!
content.protection: Pads and spotters (large rock directly in the landing zone)

content.description:
Start with two hands on the crimpy patina, as for turtle neck. Make a single move up to the edge of the 'shell' and rock over.

As with all problems at HF (and SoCal in general), it is difficult to claim an FA definitively. If you've done this problem please let me know and I'll gladly update the info!

Start at the beginning of the patina line that makes up the turtle's 'neck' (same as for Turtle Shell V0). Trend right using sloper/crimpers and cool crystal foot holds along the 'neck', up to the back of the turtle's head. Go up and over through the gap between the shell and the head.

As with all problems at HF (and SoCal in general), it is difficult to claim an FA definitively. If you've done this problem please let me know and I'll gladly update the info!
